about.title: About Time 2 Trade
about.subtitle: Intraday timing workspace: NY-time session clock with countdowns + Forex Factory-powered economic calendar, custom events, and notifications.
about.description: Time 2 Trade is a clean intraday timing workspace that shows where you are in the trading day with clear countdowns, paired with a Forex Factory-powered economic calendar.

intro.p1: Time 2 Trade is a clean intraday timing workspace for futures and forex day traders. It shows where you are in the trading day (New York, London, Asia sessions) with clear countdowns—then pairs that session context with a Forex Factory-powered economic calendar so you can see scheduled catalysts before they hit.
intro.p2: The goal is simple: reduce timing friction. Less timezone math. Less tab-hopping. Fewer "I forgot CPI was today" moments. More consistent execution decisions.

whatWeDoSection.title: What Time 2 Trade does
whatWeDoSection.intro: Time 2 Trade focuses on one job: make the trading day obvious—so you can act (or stand down) with confidence.

features.label: Session clock (NY / London / Asia) with countdowns
features.text: A visual 24-hour clock shows session windows and the countdown to key transitions. This answers "where are we right now?" instantly—without switching tools.

features.label: Forex Factory-powered economic calendar
features.text: See scheduled releases that move price. Filter by impact and currency, and keep your attention on the events that matter to your instruments and strategy.

features.label: Custom events for your personal timing rules
features.text: Add your own events (no-trade windows, routine checkpoints, session reminders, personal rules) so the app matches how you actually trade—not a generic calendar.

features.label: Notifications (where supported)
features.text: Enable reminders for upcoming events and personal checkpoints so you are not surprised by scheduled volatility mid-trade.

features.label: Personalization (optional account)
features.text: Save filters, favorites, and notes when signed in, so your routine stays consistent across devices.

whatWeDoSection.closing: Time 2 Trade is not a broker, signal tool, or execution platform. It is an awareness layer: sessions + scheduled catalysts + your own timing rules—next to your charts.

whoSection.title: Who it's built for

personas.label: Futures day traders
personas.text: If you trade ES/NQ/YM/RTY (or related markets), session timing matters. A clear session clock plus event awareness helps you avoid low-quality timing and sudden volatility windows.

personas.label: Forex day traders and scalpers
personas.text: Currency-specific filtering helps you focus on what moves your pairs. Session awareness (especially London open and New York open) keeps your routine aligned with liquidity conditions.

personas.label: Prop / funded account traders
personas.text: Constraint-driven trading demands repeatable routines. Use Time 2 Trade as a fast pre-trade check to avoid rule-breaking entries near major releases.

personas.label: Students of session-based frameworks
personas.text: If your learning process references "New York time" and session windows, this tool helps you internalize timing patterns through consistent daily use.

personas.label: Multi-timezone traders
personas.text: If you live outside the U.S. but follow NY-time education and charts, a NY-time-first workflow reduces confusion and improves consistency.

whoSection.closing: If your process includes session timing, event avoidance, and repeatable daily routines, Time 2 Trade fits naturally.

whyTimeMatterSection.title: Why visualizing time matters
whyTimeMatterSection.intro: Many trading mistakes are timing mistakes—not analysis mistakes. Entering right before a high-impact release, trading through a session transition, or executing during low-liquidity conditions can turn a good setup into a bad trade.

points.label: Session transitions
points.text: Market conditions shift around major opens and closes. Clear countdowns help you avoid entering into unstable transitions.

points.label: Scheduled catalysts
points.text: A strong setup can fail if a major release hits minutes after entry. A clean "what's coming next?" view reduces preventable surprises.

points.label: Routine consistency
points.text: A stable, repeatable pre-trade checklist is a performance advantage—especially in funded environments where discipline matters.

whyTimeMatterSection.closing: Time 2 Trade helps you answer, in real time: "What session am I in, what's coming next, and does this timing match my plan?"

dataSourceSection.title: Data source and reliability
dataSourceSection.intro: Intraday tools are judged on correctness. Session boundaries and event timing must be reliable, especially around DST and date rollovers.

points.label: Economic calendar
points.text: Calendar events are powered by Forex Factory economic event data so traders can reference a familiar source.

points.label: Timezone clarity
points.text: New York time is a common reference for intraday education. The app is designed to keep session and event timing consistent with your selected timezone policy.

points.label: No mixed signals
points.text: The product avoids "signal language." It is built for awareness and timing context—not buy/sell calls.

privacySection.title: Privacy, security, and data handling
privacySection.intro: Trust matters. Time 2 Trade is designed to be safe by default and minimal in what it stores.

storeItems.label: Guest mode
storeItems.text: Basic preferences can be saved locally on your device for a low-friction first use.

storeItems.label: Account mode
storeItems.text: If you create an account, settings can sync across devices and you can save filters, favorites, notes, and reminders (depending on feature availability).

dontItems.label: No broker connections
dontItems.text: We do not connect to your broker or execute trades.

dontItems.label: No signals
dontItems.text: We do not sell trading signals or "entries."

dontItems.label: No sensitive asks
dontItems.text: We do not require sensitive personal financial information for core functionality.

principleItems.label: Minimal data collection
principleItems.text: Only what is needed for the feature to work.

principleItems.label: Clear separation
principleItems.text: Public/guest features and account-only features are kept distinct.

principleItems.label: User-first purpose
principleItems.text: Account features exist to improve workflow consistency—not to harvest data.

principlesSection.title: Product principles
principlesSection.intro: Time 2 Trade is built around a few non-negotiables:

items.label: Clarity over complexity
items.text: The UI should answer "what time is it in my trading day?" faster than a calendar tab can load.

items.label: Consistency over novelty
items.text: The same workflow should work daily, especially for prop traders and students building discipline.

items.label: Trust over hype
items.text: No exaggerated promises, no signal claims—just reliable session + event context.

founderSection.title: A note from the founder
founderSection.p1: Time 2 Trade is built by an independent software developer focused on practical tools for intraday routines—especially session timing, event awareness, and repeatable daily checklists.
founderSection.p2: The product is intentionally narrow: it aims to be the timing layer you keep next to your charts, built with a "fast, clean, reliable" mindset rather than feature bloat.

ctaSection.title: Ready to see your trading day clearly?
ctaSection.text: Open the app and answer three questions in seconds: What session am I in? What's the next scheduled catalyst? Does this timing match my plan?

privacy.heading: Privacy Policy
privacy.introduction: Time 2 Trade is committed to transparency about how we collect, use, and protect your data. This policy explains what information we gather, why we need it, how we use it, and the choices you have.

provider.title: Information you provide
items: Email address (for authentication and account recovery)
Display name and profile photo (optional)
Trading session preferences and clock settings
Economic calendar favorites and personal notes
Custom events you create (titles, times, tags/notes you add)
Reminder preferences (e.g., notification toggles, lead time), when supported
Timezone selection and display preferences

automatic.title: Information we collect automatically
items: IP address and general location (country/region) derived for security and fraud prevention
Device type, browser type, and operating system
Session data and authentication tokens
Usage statistics (pages viewed, features used, session duration)
Error logs and diagnostic information
Meta Pixel data (page views, sign-ups, logins) for conversion tracking and ad measurement

thirdParty.title: Information from third parties
items: OAuth profile data (name, email, profile photo) when you sign in with Google or Twitter
Economic calendar event data from a Forex Factory-powered feed (market events only; no personal data shared)

services.title: Provide and maintain services
items: Authenticate your account and maintain secure sessions
Sync your preferences and settings across devices
Display economic calendar events in your selected timezone
Store your favorites, notes, and custom events
Trigger reminders and notifications (where supported) based on your settings

improve.title: Improve and develop features
items: Analyze usage patterns to optimize performance
Identify and fix bugs and technical issues
Develop new features based on aggregated usage signals
Ensure service reliability and uptime

advertising.title: Advertising
items: Display Google AdSense advertisements (where shown)
Measure ad performance and effectiveness via Meta Pixel
Track conversions (sign-ups, logins) for ad optimization
Deliver personalized ads when you allow them via cookie consent
Show non-personalized ads when you select essential-only cookies

security.title: Security and fraud prevention
items: Detect abuse, spam, and fraudulent access attempts
Protect accounts and enforce rate limits
Monitor service health and suspicious activity

providers.title: Service providers
items: Firebase Authentication (Google Cloud) - for account management
Cloud Firestore (Google Cloud) - for user settings, notes, favorites, and custom events (region configured in our Firebase project)
Firebase Hosting (Google Cloud) - for application delivery via global CDN
Firebase Cloud Functions (Google Cloud) - for backend processing (e.g., scheduled syncs and reminders when supported)
Forex Factory-powered events feed provider - for retrieving public economic calendar events (no personal data shared)

advertising.title: Advertising partners
items: Google AdSense - may collect and use data for ad delivery when you allow personalized ads
Meta Pixel (Facebook) - collects page views and conversion events (sign-ups, logins) for ad measurement and optimization
Manage Google ad preferences at Google Ad Settings (https://adssettings.google.com)
Manage Meta ad preferences at Meta Privacy Center (https://www.facebook.com/privacy/center/)

legal.title: Legal requirements
items: We may disclose information to comply with legal obligations, court orders, or government requests
We do not sell your personal data to third parties

access.title: Access and update
items: View and edit your profile information in account settings
Update display name, photo, and preferences at any time
Request a copy of your data by emailing compliance@time2.trade

delete.title: Delete your data
items: Delete your account in settings (removes personal data and preferences)
Email compliance@time2.trade to request account deletion
We process deletion requests within 30 days
Some data may be retained in backup systems for up to 90 days

cookies.title: Cookie preferences
items: Use the cookie banner to choose between personalized ads or essential-only mode
Change consent at any time by using the consent controls (if provided) or by clearing browser site data to reset the banner
Essential cookies/storage are used to maintain authentication and core app settings

adPersonalization.title: Ad personalization
items: Control Google ad personalization at Google Ad Settings (https://adssettings.google.com)
Choose essential-only cookies to receive non-personalized ads only
Ad choices do not affect core Time 2 Trade functionality

portability.title: Data portability
items: Request export of your settings, favorites, notes, and custom events in a portable format
Email compliance@time2.trade with your request
We provide data exports within 30 days (subject to identity verification)

retention.heading: Data retention and deletion
items: Account data: Stored while your account is active, plus up to 30 days after a deletion request is initiated (to complete processing and prevent abuse).
Settings, favorites, notes, custom events: Deleted when your account is deleted, subject to backup retention.
Usage logs: Typically retained up to 90 days for debugging and security monitoring.
Error logs: Typically retained up to 180 days for stability analysis.
Backup systems: Copies may persist in backups for up to 90 days after deletion.
Legal holds: Data subject to legal preservation requirements may be retained longer.

security.heading: Security measures
items: Encryption in transit: Data is transmitted using HTTPS/TLS.
Encryption at rest: Data stored on Google Cloud is encrypted at rest using Google-managed keys by default.
Access control: Role-based permissions and least-privilege service accounts.
Authentication: Secure session management with token-based authentication via Firebase Auth.
Monitoring: Operational monitoring and logging to detect outages and suspicious activity.
No client-side secrets: Backend credentials are stored in secure environment/config systems, not shipped to the client.

international.heading: International data transfers
items: Time 2 Trade is operated from the United States.
We use Google Cloud / Firebase services which may process data in the United States and other countries depending on service configuration and delivery networks.
For users in the EEA/UK: transfers rely on appropriate safeguards (such as Standard Contractual Clauses) made available by our providers.
You have the rights outlined in the "Your privacy rights" section above.

children.heading: Children's privacy
items: United States: Time 2 Trade is not intended for children under 13 (COPPA).
European Union: Not intended for children under 16 without parental consent (GDPR Article 8).
Age verification: We do not knowingly collect data from children below applicable age limits.
Parental requests: If you believe a child has provided data, contact compliance@time2.trade for deletion.

essential.title: Essential (always active)
items: Authentication tokens to keep you signed in
Session/local state to maintain app behavior
Cookie consent preferences
Timezone and display preferences

advertising.title: Advertising (optional, requires consent)
items: Google AdSense cookies for ad delivery and measurement
Meta Pixel (_fbp cookie) for conversion tracking and ad optimization
Ad personalization cookies (only when you allow personalized ads)
These are not set when you choose essential-only mode

Last updated date appears at the top of this page.

Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.
Previous versions are available upon request at compliance@time2.trade.
